review: The best media player available. When I would use to watch moves on my smart TV sometimes the move would pause or disconnect. After upgrading to the Fire TV I have not had any annoying pauses the moves play flawlessly whether it is an amazon video or a Netflix video. The wireless networking is amazing it works better then my computer at getting a signal. The remote is grate the Fire TV can be in a cabinet and it will still work and one of the nice things that I have noticed is that when it is connected to my smart TV the TVs remote will control the Fire TV through the HDMI. Now it would be grate if Amazon could come out with a universal remote that works with all components as well as there Fire TV does.Thanks for a supper product and keep up the good work!!!

review: I have personally purchased and used Apple TV 3, Roku 3, and Amazon Fire TV. My all-time favorite is AMAZON FIRE TV! I use a Windows-based laptop, so Apple TV's proprietary use is limited for me. Also, there is no Amazon Prime Streaming with the Apple TV, which is a huge letdown. I found that the Roku is awesome for its ability to be used with the built-in headset. You can do your gaming or television watching without disturbance, and without disturbing others around you.Hands-down, though, I LOVE AMAZON FIRE TV. The "voice search" is great, and there is very little buffering. What buffering there is will most likely be the fault of your WiFi. And it is nothing a quick reboot won't take care of. I highly recommend this product over all others!
